DataElement.preferredName: Person Cigarette Smoking Pack Year History Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of pack-years a person has smoked (number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked)/20. One pack-year is smoking 20 cigarettes a day for one year. Number with 3 places before the decimal and one place after the decimal point.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Cigarette Smoking Pack Year History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._Inhaling smoke from tobacco in the form of a cigarette._A quantification of lifetime tobacco exposure defined as (number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked)/20. One pack-year is smoking 20 cigarettes a day for one year._The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Inhaling smoke from tobacco in the form of a cigarette.

Concepts.definition: Inhaling smoke from tobacco in the form of a cigarette.

Property.preferredDefinition: A quantification of lifetime tobacco exposure defined as (number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked)/20. One pack-year is smoking 20 cigarettes a day for one year.:The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

Concepts.definition: A quantification of lifetime tobacco exposure defined as (number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked)/20. One pack-year is smoking 20 cigarettes a day for one year.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Observations and activities relating to behavior, such as smoking and ETOH use.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Number with 3 places before the decimal and one places after the decimal point.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created new version 1.1 to remove UOM per B. Maeske.
